meanings.definition: An instrument used to record and analyze the spectrum of light
meanings.sent1: The scientist used a spectrograph to study the colors in the light.
meanings.sent2: The spectrograph displayed a beautiful rainbow of colors.
meanings.sent3: The spectrograph had a party with all the different colors it could see.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes were like a spectrograph, breaking down the world into its colorful components.
meanings.sent5: The spectrograph hummed softly as it revealed the hidden colors of the universe.

meanings.definition: To use a spectrograph to study the composition of a substance
meanings.sent1: She will spectrograph the liquid to see what it is made of.
meanings.sent2: Scientists often spectrograph samples to understand their properties.
meanings.sent3: The detective decided to spectrograph the mysterious potion.
meanings.sent4: His mind was like a busy spectrograph, analyzing every detail of the situation.
meanings.sent5: They will spectrograph the rock to determine its mineral content.
